unnormalised: The Ministry of Education has announced a new mandatory identification system for all students and teaching staff across the country. Starting from the academic year 2025-26, every student enrolled in a recognised educational institution, from primary school to PhD level, will be assigned a unique Student Identifier (SID), a 12-digit alphanumeric code. Similarly, all teachers, professors and lecturers must obtain a Teacher Identification Number (TIN), an 8-digit number, before 31/12/2024 to continue teaching.
normalised: The Ministry of Education has announced a new mandatory identification system for all students and teaching staff across the country. Starting from the academic year two thousand twenty five to twenty six, every student enrolled in a recognized educational institution, from primary school to P-h-D level, will be assigned a unique Student Identifier (S-I-D), a twelve digit alphanumeric code. Similarly, all teachers, professors and lecturers must obtain a Teacher Identification Number (T-I-N), an eight digit number, before thirty first december two thousand twenty four to continue teaching.

unnormalised: This initiative aims to streamline data management, improve resource allocation, and enhance the overall transparency of the education system. The SID and TIN will be linked to Aadhaar numbers where applicable but will also be available to students and teachers who do not have an Aadhaar. Institutions such as IITs and IIMs are already piloting the system and reporting better data accuracy.

unnormalised: The Ministry assures that data privacy will be a top priority. Access to SID and TIN data will be strictly controlled and limited to authorised personnel. Detailed guidelines on obtaining the SID and TIN will be available on the Ministry of Education website from 15/07/2024. The help desk can be reached at 1800-11-2345.
